titlestmt.titleproper: American Chemical Society Division of Paint, Varnish and Plastics Chemistry records 1940-1941
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Chemical Society Division of Paint, Varnish and Plastics Chemistry records

bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The Polymeric Materials: Science and Engineering is one of the 33 technical divisions within the ACS. This division was originally called the Division of Paint, Varnish and Plastics Chemistry.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of papers given at the divisional section of the Fall 1940 and Spring 1941 national meetings of the ACS. Also included are abstracts of papers given at the Fall 1941 ACS national meeting.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
